s.text: Contrary to expectation, the film ends up celebrating his marriage; it's a "no-fuss movie that casts a rich, tranquil spell" (Gleiberman, Entertainment Weekly ). High marks go to Emily Watson in the role of the staid but smart wife who manages to make humdrum domesticity appealing.

Contrary to expectation, the film ends up celebrating his marriage; it's a "no-fuss movie that casts a rich, tranquil spell" (Gleiberman, Entertainment Weekly ). High marks go to Emily Watson in the role of the staid but smart wife who manages to make humdrum domesticity appealing.

On the down side, Newsweek 's David Ansen writes, "Clever as parts are, Go doesn't add up to much," and several other critics agree (Peter Rainer of New York magazine says, "There's nothing much to this movie except a lot of funky attitude").

On the down side, Newsweek 's David Ansen writes, "Clever as parts are, Go doesn't add up to much," and several other critics agree (Peter Rainer of New York magazine says, "There's nothing much to this movie except a lot of funky attitude").

On the down side, Newsweek 's David Ansen writes, "Clever as parts are, Go doesn't add up to much," and several other critics agree (Peter Rainer of New York magazine says, "There's nothing much to this movie except a lot of funky attitude").

Full-throttle raves for this first feature film for French director Erick Zonca: "Frank, intimate, touching, with an emotional immediacy that is killing" (Kenneth Turan, the Los Angeles Times ); "brilliant" (Jack Mathews, the Daily News ). The film follows the trajectory of an intense friendship that develops between two young women who meet at a sewing factory.
[Liman] does not merely appropriate the familiar, he takes it by storm."
